results.title: Rhonda’s story : spoken by Ada Peterson
results.creator_credit: Ada Peterson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Speaking for her sister, Rhonda, Ada Peterson gives us some insight into the anguish and confusion of being a member of the ‘Stolen Generation’. While Rhonda understands too well the psychological trauma experienced by the parents whose children were taken, she doesn’t understand why they refuse to talk about it today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ada Peterson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Speaking for her sister, Rhonda, Ada Peterson gives us some insight into the anguish and confusion of being a member of the ‘Stolen Generation’. results.title: Mother
results.creator_credit: Jannas Quayle, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jannas Quayle pays tribute to her mother, a lady of great strength and warmth who has watched over her family and kept them together, depsite life sending them to different places.

results.title: Memory lingers on
results.creator_credit: Colleen Johnson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Whether its in the eyes of her grandchild or the photos and memories of those loved and lost, Colleen Johnson feels a deep connection to her family. No matter what, they are her heart and soul.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colleen Johnson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Whether its in the eyes of her grandchild or the photos and memories of those loved and lost, Colleen Johnson feels a deep connection to her family. No matter what, they are her heart and soul.

results.title: From Riverbank to Dodge City
results.creator_credit: Ceciline Biles, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Moving from the riverbank to ‘Dodge City’ was like moving to another century. Regardless of the dramatic changes, some things stay the same.

results.title: Coming home
results.creator_credit: Christina Brims, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Christina Brim’s mum died recently and a lot of memories and stories have been going around in my head. Brims pays tribute to her mother, the glue that kept her ‘large mob’ together and cohesive.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christina Brims, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Barkindji memories
results.creator_credit: Simone Spencer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Simone Spencer shares the happy memories that filled her childhood. Her large family, her close friends and her time at school all contributed to the happy person she is today. It is also why she wants to help others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Simone Spencer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Simone Spencer shares the happy memories that filled her childhood. Her large family, her close friends and her time at school all contributed to the happy person she is today. It is also why she wants to help others.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: South west cinemas
results.brief_description: Take a front-seat tour of three regional Victorian cinemas, the Capitol in Warrnambool, the Lorne Theatre and the Portland Star. Your tour guides are the cinema staff, old and new, and the locals who frequent these historic cinemas and keep them alive. Despite highlighting the struggle to function commercially in the light of increased access through DVDs and downloadable films, the stories told, both colourful and romantic hint that the local cinema still has a place in people’s lives and how difficult it can be to replace the simple joy of the shared cinematic experience.
results.title_for_label: ACMI in the regions: South west cinemas

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Mount Alexander
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Shire of Mount Alexander is located in the central region of Victoria. These nine stories cover the towns Castlemaine, Newstead and Maldon. Locals from the region discuss living in the country, the reasons for choosing to living in these towns and the community spirit so crucial to the region’s survival.
